tool.name: MSstats
tool.description: MSstats analysis of Skyline output files by TMP
tool.command:
msstats_wrapper.py --galaxy-csv ${csv_input} --experiment_file ${experiment_map} --mprophet_q ${q_threshold} --rename $remove_decoys $remove_precursors $remove_repeated_peptides $peptide_level $merge_isotopes $remove_empty $censoredInt $fillMissingFeatures --cutoffCensored $cutoffCensored --renameProteinType norename --fillIncompleteRows $MBimpute $noimpute
#if $maxQuantileforCensored.censor=="NULL" --maxQuantileforCensored NULL #else --maxQuantileforCensored ${maxQuantileforCensored.selection} #end if #if $remove_proteins_by_text!="" --removeProteinsByText "$remove_proteins_by_text" #end if --normalization $normalization #if $normalization=="globalStandards" --normalization_protein "${norm_protein}" #end if
#if $featureSubset.subset=="topN" --featureSubset topN --featureSubsetN ${featureSubset.featureTopN} #else if $featureSubset.subset=="all" --featureSubset all #else if $featureSubset.subset=="highQuality" --featureSubset highQuality #end if --processedDataOutput $processedDataOutput --comparisonOutput $comparisonOutput --quantificationOutput $quantificationOutput --quantificationConditionOutput $quantificationConditionOutput --RDataOutput $RDataOutput --QCplotOutput $QCplotOutput --ProfilePlotOutput $ProfilePlotOutput --ConditionPlotOutput $ConditionPlotOutput --conditionPlotCSVOutput $conditionPlotCSVOutput --RScriptOutput $RScriptOutput

param.name: remove_precursors
param.label: Remove precursor peak areas? (For MS2 quant only)

param.name: norm_protein
param.label: Which protein will you normalize to? Must be a string unique to the protein of interest from the FASTA header!
param.help: THIS IS IGNORED IF NOT NORMALIZING BY GLOBALSTANDARDS. Multiple proteins can be comma separated. If only a subset of peptides from that protein are used for normalization, separate them with '::' (e.g. Q96T76::GLSHVLNR::AIFQEVHVQSLPQVD,CIAO1_HUMAN::DSLVLLGRVPAHPDS)

param.name: remove_repeated_peptides
param.label: Remove repeated peptides?
param.help: TEMPORARY WORKAROUND UNTIL SKYLINE FIXES THEIR IMPORT FILTERS...

param.name: merge_isotopes
param.label: Merge DDA isotopes?
param.help: DO NOT USE WITH DIA, UNTESTED...

param.name: remove_truncated_peaks
param.label: Remove truncated peaks?
param.help: Replaces truncated peak values with NA.

param.name: remove50missing
param.label: Remove RUNS with >50% missing data?
param.help: removes the runs which have more than 50% missing values.

param.name: remove_single_run
param.label: Remove peptides detected in fewer than two runs?

param.name: remove_proteins_with_interference
param.label: Remove Proteins with Interference?
param.help: TRUE allows the algorithm to remove the proteins if deem interfered. FALSE (default) does not allow to remove the proteins, in which all features are interfered. In this case, the proteins, which will completely loss all features by the algorithm, will keep the most abundant peptide.

param.name: remove_proteins_by_text
param.label: Targetted Removal of Proteins? Must be a string unique to the protein of interest from the FASTA header!
param.help: Flanking whitespace will be removed. Multiple proteins can be comma separated (e.g. Q96T76,CIAO1_HUMAN...)

param.name: censoredInt
param.label: Censored Ints are NA values instead of 0's?
param.help: If you don't know what this is, and you used mProphet, leave this as false.

tool.help: This was coded for use with MSstats 3.6 and above! (Currently 3.7.3)
